oai_dc:dc.dc:title: U.S. Claim by George Smith for damages by Confederate forces
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four page form documenting the claim against the United States of George Smith of Jefferson County, Tenn., who in 1864 near the town of Whitesburg sustained the loss of three bay horses to Confederate forces under Gen. John Crawford Vaughn. This is an early proceeding for a Civil War claim adjudicated under a state "Act to Secure to the Loyal Citizens of Tennessee, Recompense from the US Government for Losses Incurred by the Rebellion" passed by the General assembly on Feb. 19, 1863.
